description.en:
The course "International Security" introduces students of International Relations to the more specialized sub-field of Security Studies. Towards this end, the course provides students with an introduction to some of the most pressing security challenges characterizing the contemporary security environment, key concepts, as well as central in the field of Security Studies.

The problem of insecurity, and the need for states to ensure their security in an anarchic environment, is one of the most fundamental challenges states face and it is one of the most fundamental and durable features of international politics. As such, considerations of national and international security are at the very heart of the study of world politics, and the quest for security commands attention both as a matter of research and policy.

Against this background, the course aims to enable students to navigate current debates about international security. It does so by, first, introducing some of the most pressing security challenges characterizing the contemporary security environment and, second, by equipping students with the analytical tools to critically engage with these security challenges and with wider debates about security policy.
description.et:
"Rahvusvahelise julgeoleku" kursus tutvustab rahvusvaheliste suhete üliõpilastele julgeoleku-uuringute alavaldkonda. Kursus teeb sissejuhatuse mõnedesse kõige pakilisematesse julgeolekuprobleemidesse, mis iseloomustavad tänapäeva julgeolekukeskkonda, võtmekontseptsioonidesse, samuti julgeoleku-uuringute valdkonna kesksetesse teemadesse.
Puuduliku julgeoleku probleem ja riikide vajadus tagada oma julgeolek anarhilises keskkonnas on üks põhilisemaid väljakutseid, millega riigid silmitsi seisavad, ning see on üks rahvusvahelise poliitika põhilisemaid ja püsivamaid tunnuseid. Seetõttu on riikliku ja rahvusvahelise julgeoleku kaalutlused maailmapoliitika uurimise keskmes ja julgeoleku tagamine on nii teadusuuringute kui ka poliitika seisukohast tähelepanu vääriv teema.
Selle taustal on kursuse eesmärk võimaldada üliõpilastel orienteeruda praegustes rahvusvahelise julgeoleku alastes aruteludes. Selleks tutvustatakse esiteks mõningaid kõige pakilisemaid julgeolekuprobleeme, mis iseloomustavad tänapäeva julgeolekukeskkonda, ja teiseks antakse üliõpilastele analüütilised vahendid, et nad saaksid kriitiliselt tegeleda nende julgeolekuprobleemidega ja laiemate julgeolekupoliitikaga seotud debattidega.

objectives.en: The course aims to introduce students to the field of Security Studies. It does so by introducing key concepts in the study of international security, central issues and security challenges characterizing the contemporary security environment, and major debates related to international security.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada üliõpilastele julgeoleku-uuringute valdkonda. Selleks käsitletakse rahvusvahelise julgeoleku uurimise põhimõisteid, tänapäeva julgeolekukeskkonda iseloomustavaid keskseid küsimusi ja julgeolekuprobleeme ning rahvusvahelise julgeolekuga seotud peamisi debatte.

learning_outcomes.en: -	are familiar with key characteristics of the contemporary security environment;
learning_outcomes.et: - on tuttavad kaasaegse julgeolekukeskkonna peamiste tunnustega;

learning_outcomes.en: -	are able to name, describe, apply central concepts of the field of Security Studies;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad nimetada, kirjeldada ja rakendada julgeoleku-uuringute valdkonna keskseid mõisteid;

learning_outcomes.en: -	are familiar with, and are able to assess, central debates/arguments in the field of Security Studies;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunnevad ja oskavad hinnata julgeoleku-uuringute valdkonna keskseid debatte/ argumente;

learning_outcomes.en: -	are able to apply key concepts of the field of Security Studies in order to critically analyze current security challenges.
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad rakendada julgeoleku-uuringute valdkonna põhimõisteid, et analüüsida kriitiliselt praeguseid julgeolekuprobleeme.

notes.et: Kursus toimub Moodle'is, mis on ka peamine kommunikatsioonikanal. Kursuse õppejõuga saab kontakteeruda ka e-kirja teel (thomas.linsenmaier@ut.ee)

independent_work.et: Independent work with the course readings; preparation for the in-class exercises or completion of exercises in the Moodle environment before or after class. More detailed instructions for the exercises will be provided through Moodle.

grade_preconditions.et: In order to complete the course with a positive grade, course participants cannot miss more than two classes and all exercises must be completed. If any of the in-class or Moodle-based exercises is missed, the exercise can be compensated for by completing the exercise in written form.

grade_evaluation.et:
The overall course assessment is differentiated (A-F). The final grade is composed of the results of the interim assessments (60%) and the final assignment (40%). The final grade is computed as follows:

A (excellent) 100-91
B (very good) 90-81
C (good) 80-71
D (satisfactory) 70-61
E (sufficient) 60-51
F (fail) 50-0

debt_elimination.et:
Late submissions will not be accepted. Missing the deadline for assignments results in failing the assignment.

An extension of deadlines is possible only in exceptional circumstances and upon prior agreement with the course instructor.  

Extra credit: Course participants who want to improve their final grade can do so by completing an additional written assignment (wiki entry). The topic must be approved with the course instructor. Further instructions will be provided upon request. The additional assignment is worth max. 10 points.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: The mandatory course readings will be made available in Moodle.
